explanation: The loop used a fixed range(63), which is wrong because it can cause an IndexError when the input list A has fewer than 63 elements and will ignore elements if A is longer than 63. I changed that single line to iterate over range(len(A)) so the loop runs exactly for the valid indices of A.
fixed_code:
A = list(map(int,input().split()))
S = 0

import math

for i in range(len(A)):
    S = S + A[i]*(pow(2,i))
    
print(S)
